meanings.definition: To gather or cluster together in a rounded mass.
meanings.sent1: The children were conglobing around the teacher during storytime.
meanings.sent2: The snowball was conglobing as it rolled down the hill.
meanings.sent3: The puppies were conglobing in a playful heap.
meanings.sent4: The stars conglobed into a beautiful constellation in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The colorful candies conglobed into a tempting display at the store.

meanings.definition: To form into a rounded mass.
meanings.sent1: The artist was conglobing clay into a perfect sphere.
meanings.sent2: The dough was conglobing into a smooth ball as it was kneaded.
meanings.sent3: The clouds were conglobing into funny shapes in the sky.
meanings.sent4: The thoughts in his mind conglobed into a clear plan for the project.
meanings.sent5: The sand conglobed into intricate patterns as the waves washed over it.
